sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>child</radical> shares his <radical>lineage</radical> with a <kanji>grandchild</kanji>. The child passes his lineage down to his child and then that child’s child is the grandchild and between them all a lineage is shared.
meaningInfo: Look at this family tree. See the child, and then the grandchild. Trace the lineage with your finger as you observe.
readingMnemonic: The <reading>son</reading> (<ja>そん</ja>) of a son is a <kanji>grandchild</kanji>. In this case, a grandson. Easy.
readingInfo: Just remember that a son is all you really want. You need a son to carry on the family name and the lineage. So make sure that your child and your grandchild are both sons.
